intro: Argyrolobium confertum, commonly known as the denseflower burro's tail, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. It produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Argyrolobium confertum is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
